algorithm_technique: Create a mapping of alien alphabet characters to their order. Then, compare adjacent words lexicographically based on this mapping.
problem_summary_simple: Check if a list of words is sorted according to a given alien alphabet order.
problem_summary_technical: Build a character-to-order mapping. Iterate through adjacent words, comparing characters at each position based on the alien order.
time_complexity: O(C), where C is the total number of characters across all words.
space_complexity: O(1) (since the alphabet size is fixed at 26)
key_insights: The problem requires comparing words based on a custom alphabet order, not the standard English one.
A hash map is ideal for quickly looking up the order of each character in the alien alphabet.
When comparing two words, we iterate character by character. The first differing character determines the order. If one word is a prefix of another, the shorter word must come first.
